seniority_level.evidence: Title explicitly states 'Senior Data Engineer II' and requires 5+ years of relevant professional experience in data engineering or backend development.

job_family.evidence: Title is 'Senior Data Engineer II' and core responsibilities focus on data pipelines, ETL, and data infrastructure.

sub_specialty.evidence: Mentions both 'real-time and batch data integrations' and 'reverse ETL workflows' as responsibilities, with tools like Hightouch and real-time systems in bonus points.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Role mentions mentoring junior engineers, participating in code reviews, and demonstrating technical leadership through documentation and communication, but no direct reports or people management responsibilities are stated.

primary_cloud.evidence: Mentions AWS (SageMaker) and GCP (Vertex AI) explicitly, with no clear primary cloud provider emphasized.

secondary_clouds.evidence: Both AWS (SageMaker) and GCP (Vertex AI) are mentioned as part of ML workflow deployment tools.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Mentions both 'real-time and batch data integrations' and 'ML model deployment' which typically involves hybrid processing paradigms.

orchestrator_category.evidence: ETL tools like Fivetran and data modeling frameworks like DBT are mentioned, but no explicit orchestrator tools (e.g., Airflow, Step Functions) are stated.

storage_layer.evidence: Mentions large analytical databases (Redshift, PostgreSQL) and hybrid data integrations (real-time and batch), suggesting a mix of warehouse and lake storage patterns.

remote_restriction.evidence: Job posting specifies 'Registered States' within the US, implying remote work is restricted to the same country (US).

timezone_focus.evidence: Employees are expected to work with distributed teams across all US time zones, suggesting a focus on the Americas.

relocation_required.evidence: Job posting states it is a remote position and does not mention relocation requirements.

h1b_friendly.evidence: Explicitly states 'ActBlue is unable to sponsor work visas at this time'.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of OPT/CPT or student visa support, and explicitly states no work visa sponsorship.

citizenship_required.evidence: Job posting mentions no visa sponsorship but does not specify citizenship requirements, implying work authorization is sufficient.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Job posting specifies 'full-time, remote, salaried position' and mentions benefits typical for W2 employees.

benefits_level.evidence: Benefits include unlimited PTO, fully paid health/dental/vision insurance, 401K contributions, paid parental leave, home-office setup allowance, and additional perks like quarterly snack deliveries and digital subscriptions.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions contributing to 'building and evolving data products' and 'mentor junior engineers', indicating growth opportunities but no explicit career tracks.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Job posting mentions mentoring junior engineers and participating in code reviews, suggesting mentorship opportunities.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotion paths or advancement tracks in the job posting.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No discussion of internal mobility or lateral moves in the job posting.

career_tracks_available.evidence: Mentions mentoring and technical leadership but does not explicitly outline management or specialist tracks. IC track is implied by the role's focus on hands-on engineering.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Job posting lists many 'must have' skills (Python, data architecture, distributed systems, SageMaker, Vertex AI, etc.) with minimal 'nice to have' skills.

scope_definition.evidence: Job description focuses on a single role with well-defined responsibilities in data engineering and pipeline development.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Requirements align well with the seniority level (5+ years of experience, Senior Data Engineer II title).
